meanings.definition: Wave or flourish (something, especially a weapon) as a threat or in anger or excitement.
meanings.sent1: He brandished his toy sword at the dragon.
meanings.sent2: The pirate brandished his cutlass during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The clown brandished a rubber chicken at the circus.
meanings.sent4: She brandished her pen like a magic wand, ready to write her story.
meanings.sent5: The knight brandished his shield, ready to defend the castle.

meanings.definition: Display or show off (something) in a bold or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The model brandished her new dress on the runway.
meanings.sent2: The rapper brandished his bling at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The peacock brandished its colorful feathers to impress the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The artist brandished his masterpiece to the world for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The chef brandished his culinary skills in the cooking competition.
